place.name: YAVERLAND
place.gazetteerText: YAVERLAND, a parish in the Isle of Wight; on S and own bay, 8 miles ESE of Newport. Post town, Newport, Isle of Wight. Acres, 1,834; of which 960 are water. Real property, £1,135. Pop., 69. Houses, 11. The manor belonged to T. de Aula; and passed to the Russells, the Hatfields, and the Richardses. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Winchester. Value, £230.* Patron, Sir G. E. Hamond, Bart. The church is Norman. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
